concept.title: Creating documents
concept.shortdesc: The IDocument<T> interface represents an abstraction for working with documents in Couchbase Server.

conbody.p: The default implementation of IDocument<T>is the Document<T> class, which provides the following properties:

row.entry: The unique identifier for the document
The “Check and Set” value for enforcing optimistic concurrency
The time-to-live (TTL) of the document in milliseconds. A value of zero or less for infinite lifetime.
The actual document value to store. This can be a scalar value, an object, or a dynamic type.

conbody.p: The following code snippet shows how to insert a document into Couchbase:

In this example, we are using the Insert() method, which creates a document if it doesn’t exist, failing if it does. Besides the Upsert() method there are two other methods for inserting documents. The following table shows the methods that are available for storing documents in Couchbase:

row.entry: Inserts a document, failing if it already exists
Replaces a document, failing if doesn’t exist
Updates a document if it exists, otherwise inserts the document

conbody.p: If the CAS (Check and Set) or Expires value is set, they will be honored for each operation.
